titlestmt.titleproper: J. Walter Thompson Company. Brouillard Communications records
Guide to the J. Walter Thompson Company. Brouillard Communications records, 1971-1997 and undated RL.11370
titlestmt.author: Richard Collier

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-12-05 14:28:44 -0500.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: J. Walter Thompson Company. Brouillard Communications records

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: J. Walter Thompson Company. Brouillard Communications

origination.label: source
origination.corpname: John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History

did.abstract: Founded in 1864, the J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT) is one of the oldest and largest enduring advertising agencies in the United States. Brouillard Communications, a division of JWT, was established in 1973 and specialized in business-to-business advertising and corporate communications. Brouillard closed in 2009. Collection includes correspondence and other printed materials, proofs and tear sheets, slides and videocassettes. Companies represented include Eaton, Irving Trust, Mellon Bank, New York Stock Exchange and Transamerica. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.ing and corporate communications. Brouillard closed in 2009. Collection iIncludes correspondence and other printed materials, proofs and tear sheets, slides and videocassettes. Companies represented include Eaton, Irving Trust, Mellon Bank, New York Stock Exchange and Transamerica. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged into three series: General Files; Slides; Audiovisual Materials.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The J. Walter Thompson Company. Brouillard Communications records were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2004.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], J. Walter Thompson Company. Brouillard Communications records, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Carmen Pharr, Richard Collier, March 2017
Accessions described in this collection guide: 2004-0065

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related materials may be found in the following Hartman Center Collections:

J. Walter Thompson Company Account Files; J. Walter Thompson Company Corporate Documentation; J. Walter Thompson Company Domestic Advertisements; J. Walter Thompson Company Iconographic Collection; J. Walter Thompson Company New Business records.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence and other printed materials, proofs and tear sheets, slides and videocassettes. Companies represented include Eaton, Irving Trust, Mellon Bank, New York Stock Exchange and Transamerica. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.
